intro: Chloroleucon bogotense, commonly known as the Bogotá leucon, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and has a compact, herbaceous structure. Its leaves are narrow and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Chloroleucon bogotense is valued for its potential in traditional medicine and its ecological role in its native ecosystems.
